page.title: 10BLANTYRE PRIORY
page.content:
On the summit of a rock, rising perpendicularly from the river, stand the ruins of {Blantyre Priory,}being situated opposite to the ruins of {Bothwell Castle.}Its aspects contribute materially to the romance that pervades this interesting locality. It was founded some time before the year 1296. {Walter Stewart, was the first commander of this Priory, and Lord Privy Seal in 1595 was raised to the peerage under the title of{Lord Blantyre}on July 10th 1696.
The priory was surrounded by orchards, traces of which remain today, although it itself is not habitable any more.
